page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: In rural areas most people travel by car. A survey in 1981 showed bus services to be inadequate. The 'Villager' Transit minibus was bought initially to serve parishes without shops or schools. Driven by 10 regular volunteers, it soon became self- supporting. Passengers pay a flat fare. It now serves people in three counties, covering a 200 square mile area and is used by young and old individuals and groups for shopping or social events. It hopes to carry 1000 passengers a month in 1986. Pulhams Coaches travel to Cheltenham and Moreton-in-Marsh where there are other rail and bus links. A station once stood at Adlestrop but now only the main Hereford - Paddington line passes through. Both these facilities are well used by commuters.
